solution.text:
Let Ganesh’s age be x years.
Now, based on the data provided,
Ganesh’s uncle’s age = 3x + _{j}_ = _{{(3*k)+j}}_ years
\(\Rightarrow 3x + _{j}_ = _{{(3*k)+j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow 3x = _{{(3*k)+j}}_ - _{j}_\) [Taking all constants to one side]
\(\Rightarrow 3x = _{{3*k}}_\)
Dividing both sides by 3:
x = _{k}_
Therefore, Ganesh’s age is _{k}_ years

content.text: Ganesh’s uncle’s age is _{j}_ years more than three times Ganesh’s age. If Ganesh’s uncle is _{{(3*k)+j}}_ years old, how old is Ganesh?
